Senior Highlight:

Chris enrolled in September into a Senior Class with well established, long standing friendships. He quickly turned strangers into friends, and was quickly accepted into his class and is well liked by both his teachers and peers. Chris says “My favorite memory is coming into Roscoe Central School the first week of starting school here. It was amazing. I walked into this place thinking it was going to be awful. It was my last year and I didn't know anyone. But when I actually started up and got to school, the majority of everyone there was amazing. Unlike other schools, here, they would come up to me and introduce me to friends. Out of all the schools, I've been to, again and again, this was for sure the best! And I am so happy that I got the chance to experience something so great.” Chris wants to pursue a career in construction, specifically, boilers and working in tight spaces. He also wants to work with heavy machinery. Chris loves to be outside and wants to make the world a better place.

The Roscoe Central School Board of Education, Administration, Faculty and Staff are extremely proud to announce the name of the Salutatorian for the graduating Class of 2020. The Salutatorian is Alisha Trautschold, daughter of Michael Trautschold and Danielle Bivins.

Outside of school Alisha volunteers her time at the local food pantry, various music events and Kiwanis fundraisers. Alisha will be attending The University at Buffalo where she will study Evolutionary Biology and Ecology.

We recognize the experience our students and their families are going through right now. Parents and students should have received a mailing of their 3rd Marking Period report cards. Please look for the letter included in this mailing for information on the remainder of the school year.

Seniors, you will be celebrated! More to come on this.

As always, continue to reach out with any concerns to administration or teachers via email and phone calls.

Thank you, and please continue to stay safe and healthy!

-RCS Administration
